title: Overview
description: Explains the purpose of the Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS), its role in secure messaging (like S/MIME), and the high-level architecture of the OpenSSL CMS library.

title: Quick Start
description: Provides a fast, hands-on guide for developers to quickly sign, encrypt, decrypt, and verify messages using the OpenSSL CMS API with minimal theory.

title: Core Concepts
description: Delves into the architectural blueprint of CMS, explaining the fundamental components and their interactions to provide a solid conceptual foundation.

title: Content Types
description: Details the six primary CMS content types (SignedData, EnvelopedData, DigestedData, EncryptedData, AuthEnvelopedData, Data), explaining the purpose and structure of each.

title: Recipient Info Types
description: Explains the different mechanisms for managing recipient keys, covering Key Transport (KTRI), Key Agreement (KARI), Key Encryption Key (KEKRI), Password (PWRI), Key Encapsulation (KEMRI), and Other (ORI).

title: CLI Tool (`openssl cms`)
description: Provides a comprehensive reference for the 'openssl cms' command, mapping its flags and operations to the underlying library functions for a deeper understanding.

title: How-To Guides
description: Presents step-by-step, task-oriented workflows for common use cases, such as creating multi-signer messages, handling detached signatures, and implementing signed receipts.

title: Signing and Verifying
description: Covers detailed procedures for creating and verifying digital signatures, including multi-signer scenarios, detached content, and CAdES compliance.

title: Encryption & Decryption
description: Provides workflows for encrypting and decrypting data for various recipient types, including certificate-based (KTRI, KARI) and symmetric-key-based (KEKRI) methods.

title: Signed Receipts
description: Guides you through the process of requesting, generating, and verifying signed receipts to ensure message delivery confirmation.

title: Compression
description: Illustrates how to use the CompressedData content type to compress and uncompress message content, including required library support (zlib).

title: API Reference
description: Offers a comprehensive, searchable reference for all public functions in the OpenSSL CMS API, including detailed documentation for previously undocumented functions.

title: Main Functions
description: Documents high-level functions for creating, parsing, and finalizing CMS structures, such as CMS_sign(), CMS_encrypt(), CMS_verify(), and CMS_decrypt().

title: SignerInfo Functions
description: Reference for functions managing SignerInfo structures, including adding signers, managing attributes, and performing low-level signature verification.

title: RecipientInfo Functions
description: Reference for functions that manage RecipientInfo structures, covering adding recipients, setting keys, and decrypting content encryption keys for all recipient types.

title: Attribute & Cert API
description: Documents functions for managing signed/unsigned attributes, certificates, and CRLs within a CMS structure.

title: I/O and Data Functions
description: Covers functions for data I/O, streaming, and managing specific content types like Data, DigestedData, EncryptedData, and CompressedData.

title: Troubleshooting
description: Diagnoses common issues, explains error codes from cmserr.h, and provides solutions for problems encountered during CMS operations.
